content.text:
# List of State Register of Heritage Places in the City of Belmont

The State Register of Heritage Places is maintained by the Heritage Council of Western Australia. , 124 places are heritage-listed in the City of Belmont, of which seven are on the State Register of Heritage Places.
List
The Western Australian State Register of Heritage Places, , lists the following seven state registered places within the City of Belmont:

|Garratt Road Bridge
|
|Garratt Road
|Swan River, between Bayswater and Ascot
|
|1935
|23 March 2010
|
*Also referred to as MRWA 950 and Garratt Road Bridges Upstream (1935) and Downstream (1972)
*Consists of two adjacent bridges with the upstream one constructed in 1935 and the downstream one in 1972
*The longest extant timber road bridge in Western Australia
*Connecting the City of Belmont to the City of Bayswater
|
